title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [20 to 22 december 1870]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [20 to 22 December 1870]
text: Walter deari have received your letter and envelopes this wensdayWednesday morning the last day of autumn i also got the books you spoke of and have read them both through i was glad you directed those envelopes to mattyMatty and hannaHannah i will endeavor to write to both of them although they neither write to me but seldom) i have expected to hear from matt as she talked of coming on here this winter but i have not had any word as yet)Mrs OconorO'Connor was here yesterday tuesdayTuesday 21 she and jennieJennie and a lady from rhodeislandRhode Island who going to stop in brooklynBrooklyn till after the holidays she took down our address and said she should call here again) i was sorry i didentdidn't think to offer mrsMrs. OconorO'Connor a lunch for her journey to day i didentdidn't think of it till they were gone as they only staidstayed a short time and wouldentwouldn't have any refreshments whatever i was feeling quite well yesterday some days i am very lame indeed i take the sleeping drought only once in a great while when i have extreme pains in my limbs and it seems to lull the pain and i go to sleep) i think georgeGeorge will be home this saturdaySaturday he did not come on thanksgivingThanksgiving glad to hear walterWalter dear you are well that is the gretestgreatest of blessings we can have) got the radicals all safe i couldentcouldn't think of the name of iti think jennieJennie OconorO'Connor is beautifull and mrsMrs. OconorO'Connor too looks so youngWednesday 30 Nov. 1870Mrs O'Connor and Jennie O'C calledFrom Brooklyn Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [20 to 22 December 1870]
